alert.note: Alert for Elmore; Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 1:23AM CST until February 08 at 1:12AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Birmingham AL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Alabama... Tallapoosa River At The Tallapoosa Water Plant affecting Elmore and Montgomery Counties. .Heavy rainfall over the Tallapoosa River Basin over the past 24 hours has led to rises on the Tallapoosa River at the Tallapoosa Water Plant. A flood warning is now in effect. Another statement will be issued by this afternoon, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tallapoosa River At The Tallapoosa Water Plant. * WHEN...From this morning to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Creeks start to back up and cut off access to pastures. A few secondary roads begin to flood. At 25.0 feet, Lower Wetumpka Road starts to flood. Extensive flooding of low lands occurs and livestock and farm equipment should be moved to higher ground. At 32.0 feet, Some residences along Lower Wetumpka Road...Brooks Road and Anderson Road beome threatened. At higher stages evacuations may become necessary at Red Eagle Honor Farm. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 AM CST Friday the stage was 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 30.1 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
